JUDGES: Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the president of the GPE nad ORG alleging that he had violated his rights . At the same time he applied for the appointment of a lawyer to act on his behalf , for a waiver of court fees and for the exclusion of the ORG judges from the case due to their lack of impartiality .
Due to the applicant ’s modifications of his initial action the case was referred to LOC , subsequently the applicant challenged the impartiality of ORG judges .
On DATE the Ústí nad Labem Regional Court refused the applicant ’s request for the waiver of court fees and for the appointment of the lawyer . On DATE ORG upheld this decision .
In DATE the applicant lodged further submissions and ORG discontinued proceedings as he had not paid the court fees .
On DATE ORG quashed this decision as the applicant had paid the court fees in the meantime .
On DATE ORG appointed a lawyer on the applicant ’s behalf as his financial standing had deteriorated .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s challenge of the impartiality of ORG judges for the most part and excluded CARDINAL judge from the proceedings for different reasons than the ones raised by the applicant .

On DATE the High Court admitted the applicant ’s new objection as to the impartiality of ORG judges and referred the case to the ORG which in DATE granted the applicant ’s request to modify the action and to extend it to ORG .
On DATE the applicant requested the court to examine the case - files from other proceedings as supplementary evidence .

The hearing was fixed for DATE , however , it was adjourned owing to the applicant ’s health problems . At the same time the applicant withdrew the action as regards the Ministry and applied for the entry of the GPE nad ORG to the proceedings .
On DATE ORG refused the entry of ORG , which was upheld by ORG on DATE .

The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law against this decision and applied for a lawyer to act on his behalf . This request was granted , however , on DATE ORG rejected the appeal on points of law .
The applicant brought a constitutional appeal and applied for a lawyer to act on his behalf . This request was granted , however , on DATE ORG rejected the constitutional appeal .

On DATE the proceedings on merits were stayed due to the applicant ’s health problems , this decision became final on DATE ; the ORG was not informed as to whether the proceedings have resumed since . Overall , throughout the whole proceedings hearings were scheduled on CARDINAL occasions , however , they all had to be adjourned due to the applicant ’s health problems or other proceedings initiated by him .
In DATE the applicant claimed compensation for non - pecuniary damage arising from the excessive length of the above proceedings , under LAW . CARDINAL/CARDINAL as amended by LAW no . DATE .

As ORG did not deal with the applicant ’s request within the DATE statutory time - limit , he brought a civil action for damages against ORG on DATE . He specified the non - pecuniary damage allegedly suffered at CZK MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL ) .

In a letter of DATE ORG acknowledged that the proceedings were unreasonably lengthy . Taking into account the complexity of the proceedings and the applicant ’s substantial contribution to the delays , ORG awarded the applicant LAW ( EUR CARDINAL ) for non - pecuniary damage .

On DATE the Prague CARDINAL ORG dismissed the action holding that the proceedings on merits had been carried out smoothly without delays . The court found that in the absence of any judgment , it would be difficult to assess the complexity of the proceedings . Further , it considered that the applicant had contributed to the length of the proceedings by not having paid the court fees in due time , by unclear claims and by applying for extensions of the action to other parties . Besides , the proceedings were affected by the applicant ’s health and his procedural requests , which could however not be invoked to the applicant ’s detriment .
The applicant appealed and challenged the impartiality of judges of ORG and ORG ; these objections were dismissed by the directly superior courts including ORG .

On DATE ( served on DATE ) ORG upheld the judgment , finding that the proceedings were primarily affected by the applicant ’s failure to conform to the procedural rules and by his procedural requests . It considered that the ORG could not be held responsible for the delays caused by a party ’s uncooperativeness or even deliberate misconduct .

On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against a municipality seeking compensation for the lack of diligence in maintaining the ORG property that he had recovered in the restitution proceedings . At the same time he applied for a waiver of court fees .
Later , the proceedings were joined with similar proceedings ; altogether the applicant sought payment of CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) .
The hearing was fixed for DATE , however , the applicant excused himself .
In DATE and DATE the GPE nad ORG invited the applicant to provide information documenting that he had limited means to be eligible for the waiver of court fees .
On DATE ORG refused the request for the waiver of the court fees . The applicant appealed and challenged the impartiality of the judge . On DATE the appellate court upheld this decision .
On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as the applicant had not paid the court fees despite having been invited to .
On DATE the applicant appealed this decision asserting that the requests for the payment of the courts fees had not been delivered to his new address ; in DATE he supplemented the appeal .
On DATE the Ústí nad Labem Regional Court quashed the decision finding that the applicant had not been duly invited to pay the court fees as set by the relevant procedural rules .
On DATE the applicant applied for a waiver of the court fees . In DATE and DATE ORG invited him to provide the necessary information justifying the request .
On DATE , DATE and DATE the applicant challenged the impartiality of different judges .

On DATE ORG refused not to charge the applicant the court fees . On DATE ORG changed this decision and granted the waiver PERCENT of the court fees and dismissed the challenge of the judges’ impartiality .
On DATE the applicant challenged the impartiality of ORG judges .
On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings as the applicant had failed to pay the court fees despite having been invited to .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal as it had been filed outside the time - limit .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal against this decision as filed outside the time - limit . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal against this decision for the same reasons .
On DATE ORG decided on the impartiality of ORG judges .
On DATE ORG upheld the ORG decision of DATE , which became final on DATE .
On DATE the applicant claimed compensation for non - pecuniary damage arising from the excessive length of the above proceedings .

As ORG did not deal with the applicant ’s request within the DATE statutory time - limit , he brought a civil action for damages against ORG on DATE . He specified the non - pecuniary damage allegedly suffered at CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
On DATE ORG acknowledged that the proceedings were unreasonably lengthy and awarded the applicant CZK CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) for non - pecuniary damage .

On DATE the GPE CARDINAL ORG , referring to the case - law of the ORG , dismissed the action . It reiterated that out of DATE long proceedings , the delays in DATE were attributable to the first - instance court , otherwise the proceedings had been smooth . The court found that the complexity of the proceedings had been difficult to estimate as not a single hearing had been held . Further , it considered that the importance of the proceedings for the applicant had been low given that he had not attempted to accelerate them during DATE pause and that they had been discontinued eventually as he had not paid the court fees .

On DATE ( served on CARDINAL DATE ) ORG upheld the judgment , considering that from ORG perspective the proceedings had been finished in DATE , the applicant having not duly notified his new address and having not been interested in the proceedings for DATE . Under these circumstances and with regard to the low importance of the proceedings for him , the just satisfaction awarded had been appropriate .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the allegedly excessive length of judicial proceedings are set out in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE ( no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
